simple.escp.dom

Class TableColumn

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.escp.dom.TableColumn

  • public class TableColumn
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a column in TableLine.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TableColumn(java.lang.String text, int width)
      Construct a new TableColumn.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TableColumn

        public TableColumn(java.lang.String text,
           int width)
        Construct a new TableColumn.
        Parameters:
        text - a text that will be printed for this column. This text may contains placeholder.
        width - number of characters for this column.

    • Method Detail

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Get the text for this column.
        Returns:
        text for this column, may contains placeholder.

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Set a new text for this column.
        Parameters:
        text - a new text for this column, may contains placeholder.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Get the width in number of characters for this column.
        Returns:
        column's width in number of characters.

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(int width)
        Set a new width for this column.
        Parameters:
        width - a new width in number of characters.

      • getCaption

        public java.lang.String getCaption()
        Get the caption for this column.
        Returns:
        the caption of this column. If no caption is defined in this column, this method will return column's text instead.

      • setCaption

        public void setCaption(java.lang.String caption)
        Set the caption for this column.
        Parameters:
        caption - new caption for this column.

      • isWrap

        public boolean isWrap()
        Determine if the content of this column should be wrapped or truncated when the size of content is more than column's width.
        Returns:
        true if content should be wrapped or false if content should be truncated.

      • setWrap

        public void setWrap(boolean wrap)
        Enable or disable wrapping.
        Parameters:
        wrap - if true will wrap the overflowed content (move it to the next row). If wrap is false, the overflowed content will be truncated.
